definition: to sue for mercy/to ask for forgiveness/begging for magnanimity

sentences.english: Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
sentences.chinese: 宥恕不能变更畴前，但能拓宽他。

sentences.english: Itineraries and time schedule is subject to change without prior notice.
sentences.chinese: 行程及时间如有任何更改，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: Information in this list is subject to change without further notice.
sentences.chinese: 在此列表中的信息如有变更，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: Ivie reserves the right to modify or amend this privacy policy from time to time without prior notice.
sentences.chinese: 伊维有权修改或修正本隐私政策，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: The specification of all the applicances maybe modified without prior notice.
sentences.chinese: 以上产品规格如有修改，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: All product parameters above shall not be rejiggered to the confirmation of both parties.
sentences.chinese: 以上产品参数一经双方确定，恕不可再次更改。

sentences.english: P. O. Box will not be accepted.
Check the change before you leave. No refund for tickets sold.
sentences.chinese: 购票中请当面清点票款，门票售出，恕不退款。

sentences.english: Gambling in many states is looked upon as pretty evil, yet we tolerate it.
sentences.chinese: 赌博业在许多州被视为罪不可恕，而我们容忍它。

sentences.english: I do pleadvertising your pardon for the mistake I've madvertisinge.
sentences.chinese: 请您必定宥恕我所犯的错误。

sentences.english: Tickets sold are non-refundable and non-exchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 演出票一经售出，恕不退换。

sentences.english: The specifications and external appearance of this unit are subject to change without notice.
sentences.chinese: 本机的规格和外形有所变更时，恕不另行奉告。

sentences.english: Please also note that shipping rates can change without notice.
sentences.chinese: 另请注意，运费可以变更，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: I took the liberty of ordering for you. bombay sapphire, three limes.
sentences.chinese: 恕我冒昧约你来此，孟买蓝宝石，三杯莱檬。

sentences.english: Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L. P. The information contained herein is subject to change without notice.
sentences.chinese: 此处包含的信息如有更改，恕不另行通知。

definition: (humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
to calm down/to quell one's anger
lies/wild talk/to tell lies/to talk nonsense/fantasy (literature)
to obey an order/to comply/to do sb's bidding/to do as requested
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
(courteous) to be so bold as to
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
